title: forge test was able to run prior to 2nd May release but killed since 2nd June release
body:
### Component

Forge

### Have you ensured that all of these are up to date?

- [X] Foundry
- [X] Foundryup

### What version of Foundry are you on?

forge 0.2.0 (bf56869 2023-07-05T00:04:16.599332374Z)

### What command(s) is the bug in?

forge test --contracts src/test/RES02_exp.sol -vv

### Operating System

Windows

### Describe the bug

Hi,

Initially I've spotted the issue  in Ubuntu 22.04.2 LTS on Windows 11 with WSL2 and reported to [DeFiHackLabs](https://github.com/SunWeb3Sec/DeFiHackLabs/issues/320). I have recently discovered that the very same forge test command was working fine using an older foundry release. I have confirmed that the very first release that causing the `forge test` command to be killed with error 137 (due to maximum RAM consumption) is from **2nd June release**. This case is opened to report breakage that occurred back in between 2nd May and 2nd June timeframe.

Steps to reproduce:

1. Sync'ed down and installed https://github.com/SunWeb3Sec/DeFiHackLabs according to [Getting Started](https://github.com/SunWeb3Sec/DeFiHackLabs#getting-started)
2. Ran `foundryup`
3. Ran `forge test --contracts src/test/RES02_exp.sol -vv`
4. Verified the forge test command got killed (**ISSUE**) due to error 137 (if using VSCode terminal but the killed command is reproducible using both WSL2 and VSCode terminal) with screenshot similar to below:
```sh
Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:1151:5:
     |
1151 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2098:5:
     |
2098 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2428:5:
     |
2428 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:3296:5:
     |
3296 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:4742:5:
     |
4742 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (3628): This contract has a payable fallback function, but no receive ether function. Consider adding a receive ether function.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2693:1:
     |
2693 | interface IWBNB {
     | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).
Note: The payable fallback function is defined here.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2720:5:
     |
2720 |     fallback() external payable;
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (8417): Since the VM version paris, "difficulty" was replaced by "prevrandao", which now returns a random number based on the beacon chain.
  --> script/LuckyTiger_s_exp.sol:28:47:
   |
28 |         if(uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(block.difficulty,block.timestamp))) % 2 == 0) {
   |                                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (8417): Since the VM version paris, "difficulty" was replaced by "prevrandao", which now returns a random number based on the beacon chain.
  --> script/LuckyTiger_s_exp.sol:44:47:
   |
44 |         if(uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(block.difficulty,block.timestamp))) % 2 == 0) {
   |                                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (5815): Interface functions are implicitly "virtual"
   --> src/test/interface.sol:335:5:
    |
335 |     function owner() external view virtual returns (address);
    |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (5667): Unused function parameter. Remove or comment out the variable name to silence this warning.
  --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:78:9:
   |
78 |         address sender,
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (5667): Unused function parameter. Remove or comment out the variable name to silence this warning.
  --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:80:9:
   |
80 |         uint256 amount1,
   |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (2072): Unused local variable.
   --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:235:17:
    |
235 |                 uint32 blockTimestampLast
    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (2018): Function state mutability can be restricted to pure
  --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:40:5:
   |
40 |     function stringsEquals(
   |     ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Killed
```

Steps to reproduce good run using 2nd May release:
1. Ran `foundryup -C e15e33a` according to (May 2 [nightly-e15e33a07c0920189fc336391f538c3dad53da73](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/tree/nightly-e15e33a07c0920189fc336391f538c3dad53da73)
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/commit/e15e33a07c0920189fc336391f538c3dad53da73)
2. Ran `forge test --contracts src/test/RES02_exp.sol -vv`
3. Verified the run is successful with screenshot similar to below:
```sh
No files changed, compilation skipped

Running 1 test for src/test/RES_exp.sol:Attacker
[PASS] testExploit() (gas: 1086297)
Logs:
  [Start]  USDT Balance Of Hacker:: 0.000000000000000000
  [Flashloan] now Hacker usdt balance is :: 10014120.886666860414836616
  [FlashLoan]  Res Token Balance Of address(user):: 1.05937132
  [FlashLoan] swap 1 over
  [FlashLoan] swap 2 over
  [FlashLoan] swap 3 over
  [FlashLoan] swap 4 over
  [FlashLoan] swap 5 over
  [FlashLoan] swap 6 over
  [FlashLoan]  Res Token Balance Of address(user):: 916265.95063115
  [FlashLoan]  All Token Balance Of address(user):: 1088.270069500508040221
  transfer all token over
  [FlashLoan] sell Alltoken over, Hacker usdt balance is :: 8314162.195518672693528035
  [FlashLoan] sell Restoken over, Hacker usdt balance is :: 10220014.049973500894580201
  [Over]  USDT Balance Of Hacker:: 180757.719881106660102346

Test result: ok. 1 passed; 0 failed; finished in 2.49s
```

Steps to reproduce the very first bad run using 2nd June release:
1. Ran `foundryup -C cc5637a` according to (Jun 2 [nightly-cc5637a979050c39b3d06bc4cc6134f0591ee8d0](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/tree/nightly-cc5637a979050c39b3d06bc4cc6134f0591ee8d0)
https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/commit/cc5637a979050c39b3d06bc4cc6134f0591ee8d0)
2. Ran `forge test --contracts src/test/RES02_exp.sol -vv`
3. Verified the run is killed (**ISSUE**) with screenshot similar to below:
```sh
Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:1151:5:
     |
1151 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2098:5:
     |
2098 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |

    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

    --> src/test/interface.sol:2428:5:
     |
2428 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:

    |

    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:3296:5:
     |
3296 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |

    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (2519): This declaration shadows an existing declaration.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:4742:5:
     |
4742 |     function WETH() external view returns (address);
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^
Note: The shadowed declaration is here:
   --> src/test/interface.sol:829:1:
    |
829 | interface WETH {
    | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Warning (3628): This contract has a payable fallback function, but no receive ether function. Consider adding a receive ether function.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2693:1:
     |
2693 | interface IWBNB {
     | ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).
Note: The payable fallback function is defined here.
    --> src/test/interface.sol:2720:5:
     |
2720 |     fallback() external payable;
     |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (8417): Since the VM version paris, "difficulty" was replaced by "prevrandao", which now returns a random number based on the beacon chain.
  --> script/LuckyTiger_s_exp.sol:28:47:
   |
28 |         if(uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(block.difficulty,block.timestamp))) % 2 == 0) {
   |                                               ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (8417): Since the VM version paris, "difficulty" was replaced by "prevrandao", which now returns a random number based on the beacon chain.
  --> script/LuckyTiger_s_exp.sol:44:47:
   |

Warning (5815): Interface functions are implicitly "virtual"
   --> src/test/interface.sol:335:5:
    |

    |     ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (5667): Unused function parameter. Remove or comment out the variable name to silence this warning.
  --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:78:9:

   --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:235:17:

    |                 ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Warning (2018): Function state mutability can be restricted to pure
  --> src/test/RES_exp.sol:40:5:
   |
40 |     function stringsEquals(
   |     ^ (Relevant source part starts here and spans across multiple lines).

Killed
```

Additional Information:
1. The memory usage of bad run peaked at zero balance despite memory is freed by closing all unnecessary programs such as browser, VSCode as well as running RAM optimization program such as Wise Memory Optimizer.
2. For the good run, browser, VSCode etc. are all running together and does NOT need to run Wise Memory Optimizer to free up RAM.
3. Highly suspect `forge test` is recursively utilizing RAM memory that's causing the issue.
4. Once the `forge test` run got killed, most of the RAM is freed up. Unlikely this issue is caused by memory leak.
5. For good run, the solidity codes do not seem to be recompiled automatically.
6. For bad run, the solidity codes were recompiled automatically with a lot of warnings.

cc @mattsse I highly suspect that recompiling so many files is causing problems in the compilation pipeline? These are _a lot_ of contracts to recompile along with a gigantic interface.

@viper7882 what happens if you compile only one contract?
it's using about 3gb to compile before "no files changed" (while "Compiling" with the terminal spinner), then another 6gb to run tests on my machine

The minimal files to be used are two files: `resp.sol` and `interface.sol`. Same issue using these minimal file list. Chances are this issue only occurs under stressful condition.

Btw, even if re-running `forge test` without recompilation still causing the run to be killed. Is it `forge test` will still consume memory despite no file change occurs?
